@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Wrapper around native event management capabilities of the browser.
This class should not be used directly normally. It's better
to use {@link qx.event.Registration} instead.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Use the low level browser functionality to attach event listeners
to DOM nodes.

Use this with caution. This is only thought for event handlers and
qualified developers. These are not mem-leak protected!

@param.name: @param
@param.body: target {Object} Any valid native event target

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} The pointer to the function to assign
@param.description: The pointer to the function to assign

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
useCapture {Boolean ? false} A Boolean value that specifies the event phase to add
the event handler for the capturing phase or the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
A Boolean value that specifies the event phase to add
the event handler for the capturing phase or the bubbling phase.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: passive {Boolean ? false} Specifies whether to set the passive option to true or false if supported.
@param.description: Specifies whether to set the passive option to true or false if supported.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Use the low level browser functionality to remove event listeners
from DOM nodes.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: target {Object} Any valid native event target

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} The pointer to the function to assign
@param.description: The pointer to the function to assign

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
useCapture {Boolean ? false} A Boolean value that specifies the event phase to remove
the event handler for the capturing phase or the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
A Boolean value that specifies the event phase to remove
the event handler for the capturing phase or the bubbling phase.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the target of the event.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Computes the related target from the native DOM event

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Prevent the native default of the event to be processed.

This is useful to stop native keybindings, native selection
and other native functionality behind events.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Stops the propagation of the given event to the parent element.

Only useful for events which bubble e.g. mousedown.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fires a synthetic native event on the given element.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: target {Element} DOM element to fire event on
@param.description: DOM element to fire event on

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Name of the event to fire
@param.description: Name of the event to fire

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} A value that indicates whether any of the event handlers called {@link #preventDefault}. true The default action is permitted, false the caller should prevent the default action.
@return.description: A value that indicates whether any of the event handlers called {@link #preventDefault}. true The default action is permitted, false the caller should prevent the default action.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the given target supports the given event type. Useful for testing for support of new features like touch events, gesture events, orientation change, on/offline, etc. *NOTE:* This check is *case-insensitive*. supportsEvent(window, "cLicK") will return true but window.addEventListener("cLicK", callback) will fail silently!

@param.name: @param
@param.body: target {var} Any valid target e.g. window, dom node, etc.
@param.description: Any valid target e.g. window, dom node, etc.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Type of the event e.g. click, mousedown
@param.description: Type of the event e.g. click, mousedown

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the given event is supported
@return.description: Whether the given event is supported

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns the (possibly vendor-prefixed) name of the given event type.
*NOTE:* Incorrect capitalization of type names will *not* be corrected. See
{@link #supportsEvent} for details.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: target {var} Any valid target e.g. window, dom node, etc.
@param.description: Any valid target e.g. window, dom node, etc.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Type of the event e.g. click, mousedown
@param.description: Type of the event e.g. click, mousedown

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String|null} Event name or null if the event is not supported.
@return.description: Event name or null if the event is not supported.
